collection_1.title: Rose
collection_1.describtion: The rose is a fragrant and symbolically rich flower, cherished for its beauty and cultural significance

collection_1.title: Sunflower
collection_1.describtion: Vibrant and bold, the sunflower is a symbol of joy with its large, golden petals radiating around a central disc.

collection_1.title: Tulip
collection_1.describtion: Graceful and diverse, the tulip signifies elegance and has a variety of colors, each conveying different emotions.

collection_1.title: Carnation
collection_1.describtion: Carnations, in various hues, represent love and fascination, making them a popular choice for expressing affection

collection_1.title: Cherry
collection_1.describtion: Delicate and fleeting, cherry blossoms symbolize beauty and the transient nature of life in Japanese culture

collection_1.title: Daffodil
collection_1.describtion: Bright and cheerful, daffodils herald the arrival of spring, symbolizing renewal and the promise of new beginnings

collection_2.title: Daisy
collection_2.describtion: Simple and charming, daisies are associated with purity and innocence, often evoking feelings of simplicity and loyalty

collection_2.title: Hibiscus
collection_2.describtion: Exotic and vibrant, the hibiscus is known for its large, showy flowers and is a symbol of beauty and femininity

collection_2.title: Lilium
collection_2.describtion: Elegance personified, lilies are versatile flowers that symbolize purity, renewal, and the transience of life.

collection_2.title: Orchid
collection_2.describtion: Exotic and alluring, orchids represent love, beauty, and strength, making them a symbol of rare and delicate charm

collection_2.title: Aster
collection_2.describtion: Asters, with their star-like blooms, convey a message of love and patience, adding a touch of magic to gardens

collection_2.title: Lily
collection_2.describtion: Majestic and regal, lilies symbolize purity, virtue, and the restored innocence of the soul.
